This License, Development and Commercialization Agreement grants Aimmune exclusive, worldwide rights to Xencor’s anti-IgE antibody (the Product, formerly XmAb7195) for the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of human diseases, particularly food allergies.

Aimmune is obligated to use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to develop and commercialize the Product globally and bear all associated costs (100% of R&D, manufacturing, and commercial expenses). Xencor’s key obligation is to license the technology and comply with restrictive covenants prohibiting it from developing competitive products.

Aimmune must provide Xencor an Upfront Payment ($5 million cash and $5 million in equity), up to $385 million in milestone payments, and tiered royalties (high single-digit to mid-teen percentages) on net sales. Notable risks include termination rights for material breach (60 days cure) and immediate termination if Aimmune challenges Xencor’s licensed patents. Royalty rates are subject to reduction based on patent coverage or generic competition.

summary:
This Co-Branding Agreement establishes a joint marketing program for NETTAXI and SpinRecords.com to maximize web traffic, impressions, and user base growth by integrating services and branding (e.g., search, email, and e-commerce) across both websites.

Key obligations require both parties to use reasonable commercial efforts and significant joint monthly investments (minimum $20,000 each) to market the co-branded pages. SpinRecords.com must pay NETTAXI 50% of qualifying ad revenue (subject to a minimum $6.50 CPM) plus a 5% commission on gross sales from co-branded customers.

summary:
This Distribution and Development Agreement (DDA) establishes Sekisui as the exclusive worldwide distributor of Qualigen’s clinical rapid diagnostic products for an initial term of five years.

**Key Obligations:** Qualigen must exclusively manufacture and supply the products, maintain all regulatory approvals, and adhere to the Development Plan milestones. Sekisui is required to use commercially reasonable efforts for promotion and sales, and must fund product development by providing up to $6.2 million in milestone-based "Financing Payments" to Qualigen. Commercial profits (Available Margin) are split, heavily favoring Sekisui initially (90%), declining to 65% after two years.

**Risks and Penalties:** The agreement contains explicit acquisition provisions, granting Sekisui a Right of First Refusal (ROFR) to match any third-party sale offer, with Sekisui’s Financing Payments credited against the purchase price.
